sen.j: 大伴国麻呂（おおとものくにまろ、生没年不明）は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period.
OTOMO no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.
OTOMO no Kunimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a person in the Asuka period in Japan.

sen.j: 当時の有力氏族大伴氏に属するが、系譜は不明。
sen.e: He belonged to the then powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy has remained unknown.
He belonged to the Otomo clan, the powerful clan at that time, but his genealogy is unknown.
He belonged to the Otomo clan, the powerful clan at that time, but his genealogy is unknown.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Muraji.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Muraji.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Muraji.

sen.j: 675年に新羅に大使として遣わされ、翌年帰国した。
sen.e: In 675, he was sent to Shilla (ancient Korean kingdom) as an ambassador and the next year, he returned to Japan.
In 675, he was sent to Silla (ancient Korean kingdom) as an ambassador and the next year, he returned to Japan.
In 675, he was sent to Silla (ancient Korean kingdom) as an ambassador and the next year, he returned to Japan.

sen.j: 天武天皇4年7月7日（675年8月3日）に、大伴連国麻呂が大使として新羅に派遣されたことが、『日本書紀』に見える。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) described that OTOMO no Muraji Kunimaro was sent to Shilla as an ambassador by order of the Emperor Tenmu on August 3, 675.
In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) it is described that OTOMO no Muraji Kunimaro was sent to Siilla as an ambassador by order of the Emperor Tenmu on August 3, 675.
sen.cmt: it is describedに訂正しました。Shilla →Silla
sen.e: In "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) it is described that OTOMO no Muraji Kunimaro was sent to Siilla as an ambassador by order of the Emperor Tenmu on August 3, 675.

sen.j: 国麻呂の冠位はこのとき小錦上で、小錦下の三宅入石を副使として伴った。
sen.e: His official rank at that time was Shokinjo (the tenth grade of twenty-six official ranks) and he was accompanied by Shokinge (the twelfth grade of twenty-six official ranks), MIYAKE Nyuseki as a vice-envoy.
sen.cmt: 「三宅入石」の読み方不明のため、「MIYAKE Nyuseki」としました。
sen.e: His official rank at that time was Shokinjo (the tenth of twenty-six official ranks) and he was accompanied by Shokinge (the twelfth grade of twenty-six official ranks), MIYAKE Nyuseki as a vice-envoy.
sen.cmt: tenth grade of ranks? Tenth of ranks?（他のファイルに施した修正にならい、ここも修正しました。）三宅入石＝読み方不明
sen.e: His official rank at that time was Shokinjo (the tenth of twenty-six official ranks) and he was accompanied by Shokinge (the twelfth grade of twenty-six official ranks), MIYAKE Nyuseki as a vice-envoy.

sen.j: 翌年（676年）2月に新羅から戻った国麻呂らが到着した。
sen.e: In February, 676, he and his mission returned to Japan from Shilla.
In February, 676, he returned to Japan from his mission in Silla.
sen.cmt: he and his mission returnedはおかしいので修正しました。Shilla →Silla
sen.e: In February, 676, he returned to Japan from his mission in Silla.

sen.j: 国麻呂について他に知られることはない。
sen.e: Other things about Kunimaro have remained unknown.
Other things about Kunimaro is unknown.
Other things about Kunimaro is unknown.
